alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 05 at 8:17PM CDT until June 05 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Decatur County in northwestern Kansas... Southwestern Red Willow County in southwestern Nebraska... * Until 900 PM CDT. * At 817 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 8 miles southeast of McCook, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Decatur and southwestern Red Willow Counties, including the following locations... Traer and Cedar Bluffs. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
